Title: A closed set in a metric space is $G_\delta$
Content: How do I prove that a closed set $F$ in the metric $(X,d)$ is $G_\delta$. Let $n\in \mathbb{N}$. I consider $B_n={F}=\bigcup_ {x\in F} B(x,{1\over n})$, which is a collection of an open ball. Then I guess what I have to show next is the intersection of all these open balls is the closed set F. I'm not sure how to do that, please help me. Thank you so much.
AcceptedAnswer: If $\displaystyle{x\in\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty}B_n}$ , then for each $n$ , by the definition of $B_n$ , there is some $x_n\in F$ with $d(x_n,x)<1/n$ .  Then $(x_n)$ converges to $x$ , so as $F$ is closed $x\in F$ .
